intro: Scleria neesii var. gadchiroliensis, commonly known as the Gadchiroli sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or wetlands. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
